DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: CHIODI, S. I.;Sara Isabella Chiodi;CHIODI, SARA ISABELLA;Sarah Chiodi;CHIODI, SARAH ISABELLA

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Sarah Isabella Chiodi, Architect and PhD in Spatial Planning and Local Development, is currently managerial employee at the Municipality of Pino Torinese (IT) - Environment and Urban Planning Area- and is annual contract professor of Environmental Sociology (within the 'Atelier Progetto Urbanistico', Master of Science ?Architettura per il Progetto Sostenibile') at the Politecnico di Torino since 2011. She has been research fellow in urban and spatial planning and has participated in several national and international conferences as speaker. Her research interest focuses in the relationship between social sciences and urban planning and her research perspectives are oriented to spatial and strategic planning at the metropolitan scale. Among her last publications: Chiodi S. (2016), 'Crime Prevention through Urban Design and Planning in the Smart City Era. The Challenge of Disseminating CP-UDP in Italy: Learning from Europe', Journal of Place Management and Development, Vol. 9 Iss: 2, pp.137-152; Chiodi S. (2016), 'Strumenti intelligenti per città più sicure', Sociologia Urbana e Rurale, No.109, pp. 40-60; S.Chiodi, M.Tabasso (2016), ?A National Research Agenda for Integrated SPpatial Planning, Land Use and Soil Management?, New Dist Special Issue: SBE16 Towards Post-Carbon Cities, pp.243-255.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Sarah Isabella Chiodi, Architect and PhD in Spatial Planning and Local Development, is currently managerial employee at the Municipality of Pino Torinese (IT) - Environment and Urban Planning Area- and is annual contract professor of Environmental Sociology (within the 'Atelier Progetto Urbanistico', Master of Science ?Architettura per il Progetto Sostenibile') at the Politecnico di Torino since 2011. She has been research fellow in urban and spatial planning and has participated in several national and international conferences as speaker. Her research interest focuses in the relationship between social sciences and urban planning and her research perspectives are oriented to spatial and strategic planning at the metropolitan scale. Among her last publications: Chiodi S. (2016), 'Crime Prevention through Urban Design and Planning in the Smart City Era. The Challenge of Disseminating CP-UDP in Italy: Learning from Europe', Journal of Place Management and Development, Vol. 9 Iss: 2, pp.137-152; Chiodi S. (2016), 'Strumenti intelligenti per città più sicure', Sociologia Urbana e Rurale, No.109, pp. 40-60; S.Chiodi, M.Tabasso (2016), ?A National Research Agenda for Integrated SPpatial Planning, Land Use and Soil Management?, New Dist Special Issue: SBE16 Towards Post-Carbon Cities, pp.243-255.

Post-Doc Research Fellow at the Polytechnic of Turin, Italy. Principal Investigator of the research entitled 'Governance in housing policies'. Research skills acquired: literature review and analysis, stakeholders interviews, case studies analysis, field work (participant observation).

Member of the local Research Group (Polytechnic of Turin) within the National Research Program (Prin 2009) entitled ?Public Spaces, moving populations and urban renewal programs? Competences: literature review, empirical qualitative analysis in the field; stakeholders? interviews.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Dipartimento di Scienze e Tecniche per i Processi di Insediamento

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The aim of the research is to identify innovative and effective responses to the social housing issue whichis emerging in the Italian cities after the economic crisis. The research stands on the assumption that the traditional housing model is over and some new phenomena of cohabitation are emerging, albeit they are marginal.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CHIODI, S. I.;Sara Isabella Chiodi;CHIODI, SARA ISABELLA;Sarah Chiodi;CHIODI, SARAH ISABELLA

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Interuniversity Department of Regional and Urban Studies and Planning

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Integrated Spatial Planning, Land Use and Soil Management Research Action
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main purpose of INSPIRATION1 project is to formulate, consult on and revise an end-user oriented Strategic Research Agenda (SRA) for integrated spatial planning and soil-water-sediment system management at the European level, in the light of the societal challenges addressed by the European Commission. Beyond the European agenda, which will be developed and implemented within the next two years, research gaps in current activities on soils and land use related societal needs have been identified and prioritized at national level. The project is based on a bottom-up and interdisciplinary approach, involving stakeholders and institutions within each country involved in the project. I participate in the research group based in Italy and coordinated by the Higher Institute on Territorial Systems for Innovation. 17 cuntriesand 24 institutions and companies are involved in the project.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Integrated Spatial Planning, Land Use and Soil Management Research Action

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CHIODI, S. I.;Sara Isabella Chiodi;CHIODI, SARA ISABELLA;Sarah Chiodi;CHIODI, SARAH ISABELLA

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Interuniversity Department of Regional and Urban Studies and Planning

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Public Spaces, moving populations and urban renewal programs
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The research is National Research Program (PRIN 2009) funded by Italian Education Minister (MIUR) and involves 6 Italian universities based in different cities (Sassari, Turin, Milan, Genoa, Bologna, Perugia, Bari). The prof. A. Mazzette of the University of Sassari was the coordinator, while the prof. A. Mela was the coordinator of the local unit of the Politecnico di Torino, of which I was part. The research investigates the social use of public space through field work and stakeholders interviews, and concentrates in local case studies.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CHIODI, S. I.;Sara Isabella Chiodi;CHIODI, SARA ISABELLA;Sarah Chiodi;CHIODI, SARAH ISABELLA

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Dipartimento di Scienze e Tecniche per i Processi di Insediamento

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Social Science, Urban Planning and Design, the role of planner and sociologist
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The research is National Research Program (PRIN 2005) funded by Italian Education Minister (MIUR) and involves 4 Italian universities based in different cities (Florence, Rome - 2 units, Turin, Sassari). The prof. G.Amendola of the University of Florence was the coordinator, while the prof. A. Mela was the coordinator of the local unit of the Politecnico di Torino, of which I was part. The research investigates social changes at urban scale, identifying social forms and examining the processes that produce certain patterns of human settlement (as housing districts, urban neighbourhood etc.). It is characterized by an interdisciplinary approach across urbanism and social science, notably sociology and psychology.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Social Science, Urban Planning and Design, the role of planner and sociologist

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Participation Forms and Social Phenomena in Planning Experiences of 5 Italian Regions

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CHIODI, S. I.;Sara Isabella Chiodi;CHIODI, SARA ISABELLA;Sarah Chiodi;CHIODI, SARAH ISABELLA

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Interuniversity Department of Regional and Urban Studies and Planning

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Les implications de sécurité dans les projets urbains
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The research investigates how the physical environment influences social behavior, focusing on public spaces. It refers to strategies that contribute to having safer cities, by gathering international experiences. Safety is interpreted as a social value to which planning, urban design and maintenance of public space could contribute.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Les implications de sécurité dans les projets urbains

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Summary PARTE I 6 Cap. 1. Le teorie di prevenzione del crimine ?place based? 6 1.1 I precursori delle teorie di prevenzione del crimine ?place based? 7 1.2 La Crime Prevention Through Environmental Design (CPTED) 12 1.3 La teoria di Defendible Space e i suoi sviluppi 17 1.4 Altri significativi contributi alla prevenzione ambientale del crimine 24 1.5 La seconda generazione della CPTED 27 1.6 La Situonational Crime Prevention 30 1.7 L?Environmental criminology 33 1.5 La terza generazione della CPTED 35 Cap.2 Le applicazioni della prevenzione ambientale del crimine negli Stati Uniti e in Europa 39 2.1 USA 41 2.2 La Gran Bretagna 45 2.3 L?Olanda 53 2.4 Altri paesi d?Europa 57 2.5 L?Unione Europea 58 Cap. 3 Recenti pratiche urbanistiche influenzate dai principi di prevenzione del crimine 69 3.1 Space Syntax 69 3.2 New Urbanism 72 3.3 Gated communities 76 Conclusioni parte I 80 PARTE II 83 Cap.4 L'approccio legislativo alla sicurezza urbana: l'Italia e la Francia 83 Cap.5 Normative e strumenti in materia di prevenzione del crimine e progettazione urbana: l'Italia e la Francia 96 Cap.6 I casi studio francesi 109 6.1 Lyone Confluence 111 6.2 La Duchère: Grand Projet De Ville (2003-2016) 124 Cap.7 Le interviste a testimoni privilegiati 131 7.1 La tipologia d'intervista 131 7.2 Gli esiti delle interviste 134 Cap.8 La psicologia dell'architettura: un approfondimento 141 8.1 Le origini della psicologia ambientale 141 8.2 Parole chiave della psicologia ambientale o architettonica 142 8.3 Metodi, strumenti tipici della psicologia ambientale 146 8.4 La scala territoriale di riferimento 148 8.5 Osservazioni conclusive: gli elementi rilevanti in materia di sicurezza urbana e progettazione urbanistica 149 Conclusioni generali 155 Bibliografia generale 159 PARTECIPAZIONE A CONVEGNI E PUBBLICAZIONI 171 Elenco allegati 173
